snippet: Facing anti-Semitism in Ukraine, Dora and Motel Shkolnick obtained visas to come to the United States in 1973 with hopes of creating a better future for their children.
abstract: UJA-Federation of New York, one of seven organizations supported by The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund, provides Holocaust survivors Dora and Motel Shkolnick with funds to help live in their apartment in Brighton Beach, Brooklyn.
lead_paragraph: Facing anti-Semitism in Ukraine, Dora and Motel Shkolnick obtained visas to come to the United States in 1973 with hopes of creating a better future for their children.

headline.print_headline: Trying to Forget Holocaust While Creating Better Life
headline.main: Seeking a Better Life While Trying to Forget the ‘Long, Terrible Years’ of the Holocaust

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: New York Times Neediest Cases Fund
